baseline_groups.claim_summary: GRW subsidy rate reforms reduce total GRW subsidy receipts at the county level in East Germany.
baseline_groups.notes: Baseline uses first-differenced log total GRW subsidies as outcome with state-year FE and AMR clustering. Coefficient 0.029 (p=0.226). Positive sign expected since higher reform values correspond to subsidy rate cuts reducing receipts. Paper main claim uses confidential BHP data for manufacturing employment; this is a secondary public-data outcome.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: GRW subsidy rate reforms reduce subsidized investment volume at the county level in East Germany.
baseline_groups.notes: Alternative baseline outcome measuring subsidized investment volume rather than total subsidies. Same specification structure as G1. Coefficient 0.037 (p=0.194). Closely related but distinct outcome measure.

global_notes: Critical limitation: Paper primary finding concerns manufacturing employment effects using confidential BHP data not in replication package. All 68 specs use county-level aggregates only. Several specs are exact duplicates of baseline (did/fe/state_year, robust/cluster/amr, robust/control/none, robust/outcome/grw_total all reproduce identical results). Treatment variables robust/treatment/small, medium, and large produce identical coefficients suggesting a coding issue where size-specific treatments were not properly constructed.
